comment._content: Wow this is great. So surreal in image and word.

comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: A unicorn and the arm of the green man holding a forest bough?  Intriguing.  I wonder what these two symbols represented to the owner.  Does anyone know anything about George Head Head?

comment.author: 49015875@N00
comment._content:
Oh yes a bit. He married Sarah Gurney the daughter of THE gurneys who owned the bank. I have a picture too. Oh and why is this picture copyright - All rights reserved? You can't copyright something of this age.

I was looking to see if he had done anything ... anyone got some more?

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: Hi victuallers2,  technically we don't know the date on this.  Anything after 1923 could have copyright issues.  Because we don't know, we can't offer a more liberal license.  That may change as we do more research on this object.

comment.author: 49015875@N00
comment._content: I put this article together the bits I have found out so far here en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Head_Head Note the picture also claims to be copyright ...it was painted in 1840) when George looks already in his 30s or 40s. Hope this helps ... you can add more? I also had a look at your collection online in Flickr and In should apologise for any grumpiness ... your copyright labelling needs to be copied by others - well done. Ive added as much as I can find on ghh. Sadly could not find his birth or death. cheers

comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: Nice wiki victualler2 - enjoyed reading about Mr. Head Head and family, and seeing the portrait from a larger painting.
